project.teaser: CEE2ACT will empower countries in Central Eastern Europe and beyond (Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Greece, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia and Slovenia) - CEE2ACT target countries - to develop circular bioeconomy strategies and action plans through knowledge...
project.objective: CEE2ACT will empower countries in Central Eastern Europe and beyond (Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Greece, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia and Slovenia) - CEE2ACT target countries - to develop circular bioeconomy strategies and action plans through knowledge transfer and innovative governance models enabling sustainability and resilience to achieve better informed decision-making processes, societal engagement and innovation, building on the practice of experienced countries serving as role models in this context (Austria, Germany, The Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, Finland, Sweden). Knowledge transfer and inspiration in creative formats that address the motivations, needs and knowledge gaps of each CEE2ACT target country will be realized through the CEE2ACT National Bioeconomy Hubs. A participatory, non-political, bottom-up approach will be applied throughout the project activities, tackling specific knowledge gaps and shortcomings of the top-down conventional approach, building closer interconnections between actors across public institutions, private sector, industry, energy, SMEs, feedstock providers (e.g., waste, side streams, farmers, foresters, fishermen), academia and research, NGOs, CSOs in the target countries. To achieve this, a baseline assessment will be carried out (socio-economic and environmental aspects), stakeholder engagement activities will be implemented ensuring the proper involvement and active participation of all relevant stakeholders. Digital solutions for sustainable governance will be created, exchange of know-how and best practices on technology transfer, building the capacities of the stakeholders to develop bioeconomy strategies. The findings will be synthetized, in an analytical framework, which will result in National-level Roadmaps for the Bioeconomy Strategies in Targeted CEE2ACT countries, boosting societal engagement in the countries’ transition towards circular bioeconomy.
project.title: Empowering the Central and Eastern European Countries to Develop Circular Bioeconomy Strategies and Action Plans
project.keywords: circular bioeconomy, sustainable governance, digital solutions, Central and Eastern Europe, bottom-up approach, National Bioeconomy Hubs, National-level roadmaps for the bioeconomy strategies

article.title: Advancing bioeconomy in Central and Eastern Europe
article.teaser: With support of the CEE2ACT project and expert knowledge from across Europe, 10 CEE countries are moving their bioeconomy forward.

article.title: Strengthening the EU’s prosperity through sustainable and circular bioeconomy innovations

RTD - Open Innovation and Open Science
Results Pack
category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.title: Strengthening the EU’s prosperity through sustainable and circular bioeconomy innovations
article.teaser: Sustainable and circular bioeconomy innovations can help safeguard our quality of life and deliver benefits for people, planet and prosperity. Bioeconomy innovations will reduce Europe’s dependency on non-renewable resources and imports, and reinforce the connection between the economy, society and the environment. They contribute to climate change mitigation and adaptation, while enhancing sustainable competitiveness of European industries and businesses. This CORDIS Results Pack features 15 EU-funded research and innovation projects in the field of bioeconomy, showcasing a wide range of benefits, from reducing environmental impacts to generating jobs.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CEE2ACT (Empowering the Central and Eastern European Countries to Develop Circular Bioeconomy Strategies and Action Plans)
result.teaser: CEE2ACT empowers countries in Central Eastern Europe and beyond (Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Greece, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia and Slovenia) - CEE2ACT target countries - to develop circular bioeconomy strategies and action plans through knowledge...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Baseline assessment report on bioeconomy implementation and policy development in CEE2ACT target countries
result.description: Report on a comprehensive assessment of current status of bioeconomy implementation across all partners countries. This report will enable reporting on as is status of bioeconomy and policy development.

result.title: Online Inventory of good practices for establishment of bioeconomies and green transition
result.description: online-inventory of most up-to-date good practices by sector for establishment of bioeconomies, existing on-line facilities and similar projects.

result.title: National bioeconomy hubs
result.description: The National bioeconomy hubs (NBHs) will be the platforms on which the project will bring together relevant stakeholders in the form of workshops, forums and other activities, adopting a gender-inclusive approach.

result.title: Set of sustainability criteria and indicators for bioeconomy implementation
result.description: Report on sustainability criteria and key performance indicators of key bioeconomy sectors in the CEE2ACT target countries.

result.title: Interim Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: Updated guidelines presenting all expected project results and set out the exploitation routes for each result, ensuring that communication, dissemination, and exploitation activities all contribute to long-term project impact.

result.title: Capacity building strategy & Knowledge transfer programme
result.description: Training and capacity building programme with targets, collaboration approaches, technologies & innovation options, action lines, monitoring and evaluation approaches accessible, comparable, and linked to the CEE2ACT target country specific context of their bioeconomy roadmaps

result.title: CEE2ACT website and visual identity guidelines
result.description: A project website (M3) with general information and an online strategy (integrated into the CD&E Plan) will be developed to communicate to stakeholders and policymakers. Developed communication materials (logo, poster, infographics, rollup banners, project brochure) in 10 languages, to strengthen awareness of the project.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: Guidelines (report) on Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation, It will present allexpected project results and set out preliminary exploitation routes for each result, ensuring that communication, dissemination, and exploitation activities all contribute to long-term project impact.

result.title: Possibilities for the use of biomass from forestry with the aim of establishing a circular bioeconomy in Serbia

details.authors: Brašanac-Bosanac, Lj., Čule, N., Đorđević, I., Češljar, G., Ćirković-Mitrović, T.

result.title: CEE2ACT B2B matchmaking online tool
result.description: Online tool aimed at bringing together relevant stakeholders (SMEs, large companies, R&D institutions, universities, etc) from different regions/countries of the CEE2ACT region, to present themselves and build partnerships, serving as a “marketplace”.

result.title: E-learning platform for promoting bioeconomy and sustainable governance
result.description: CEE2ACT e-Learning platform for the target groups and NBHs members, it include a set of online courses divided into thematic training modules that will be made available beyond the end of the project.

result.title: Self-assessment tool for bioeconomy promotion
result.description: E-tool for Self-assessment for bioeconomy promotion and assessment of the current state of the CEE2ACT region on bioeconomy and green transitions and providing recommendations to support bioeconomy initiatives implementation.

category.title: nongovernmental organizations
category.displayCode: /social sciences/political sciences/political policies/civil society/civil society organisations/nongovernmental organizations

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
